title: Disappearing acts: calligrapher
content:
[http://www.guardian.co.uk/money/audioslideshow/2010/feb/18/work-and-careers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023171357/http:/www.guardian.co.uk/money/audioslideshow/2010/feb/18/work-and-careers "http://www.guardian.co.uk/money/audioslideshow/2010/feb/18/work-and-careers")

On the Guardian website today:  
Disappearing acts: calligrapher  
Audio slideshow: Paul Antonio demonstrates ancient skills with pens, ink and paper in his studio
author: geraintf

comments.content:
I met Paul in London last year, he's a master of the split-nib styles. I've had his writing of my name in gold ink sitting on my desk for months now, and still take time to examine and appreciate it often.

He's also a very fine singer, and likes to sing period-appropriate music depending on what script he is writing.
